content.description: Sit start in crack left of mono problem.  Lieback your way up the crack; when it becomes to small for fingers, get ready to throw to a small divot just right of the seam, high on the face.  Its sharp!  Hold on and inch your way up to the top edge and mantle out.  The lack of feet make it feel sketchy but it's a fun problem!  Avoid the flakey crimps out left as they appear to be part of another problem.
content.location: The crack just left of the mono problem; peters out into a seam.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the flake.  Climb up the flake on underclings and finish out the top.  Same top-out as for Honeycomb (crux).
content.location: Honeycomb boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Work up the crimpy face to the right of the mono problems.  Don't tweak anything!
content.location: Right side of Mono Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start in huecos at base of arete.  Climb straight up and out the arete.  To maintain the grade, stay on the arete and dont stem off the wall behind you/to your right.
content.location: Left of the stairs.  See pic of Star Boulder in area description.

content.description: Sit start in obvious, plate sized hueco.  Rally up crimps and edges to the top.
content.location: Left of the stairs.  See pic of Star Boulder in area description.

content.description: Start just left of the stairs.  Walk up easy slab to the top of the Honeycomb Boulder.
content.location: Right side of the Honeycomb Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Stand start with fingertips in tiny, crimp pocket.  Work up shallow pockets and a left hand sloper to top out.  For full value, don't use the crimp above Shallow Pocket Right.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start in large hueco just right of the pocket warmup problem.  Move up the hueco to your own set of shallow pockets, hit a crimp, then throw to the finish jug and top out.
content.location: Shallow Pocket Warmup Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the "coin" sized line of pockets without using the huge hueco features to the right, or dishes to the left.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Start with Right finger in mono.  Get high feet and throw for the good undercling.  Work the ridge up and left and top out.  Someone has probably done the sit start for this, but I'm not sure what it would go at.
content.location: Mono Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Start with Left finger on mono.  Work the corner up and top out.
content.location: Mono Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start in obvious mess of huecos on right side of Pocket Warmup.  Climb out the easy huecos to a surprisingly difficult top out.
content.location: Right side of Pocket Warmup Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: The coolest looking wall at Dierkes.  Sit start in the mess of huecos.  Looks like a VO, but the top out is not straightforward.  The guidebook call it V5, I don't think so.  Deceivingly hard. Go left from the top of the huecos following a small crack for full quality.
content.location: Center of the Honeycomb Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start in corner of Star Boulder.  Work up hueco until you can get a good undercling.  A good pinch intermediate is out right.  Throw hard to 3 finger pocket around the corner, adjust your feet, and then throw again for the top rail.  Hint: a good toe-hook might make all the difference.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start with foot in ground level hueco.  Work up pockets and edges to the top.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Stand start on small crimps on left side of Chocolate Face.  Work up on crimps, snag a sidepull in the shallow hueco on your right, and slap for the slopey top.  A hard mantle!
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb obvious flake without using the wall to your left (Chocolate Eliminates).
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start at base of huecos.  Work up huecos to high undercling.  Throw to the slopey top and mantle out.  The wall to your right is off.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Alternate start to Chocolate Crack.  Sit start with left hand in crack and right on sidepull.  Work up the crack with your left and the flake with your right until they meet.  Finish on the top 1/2 of Chocolate Crack.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Work up the fun crack to easy finish.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start at base of crack.  Work up and right, match crimp rail, snag sidepull on shallow hueco, and throw for the top.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the obvious and huge "bucket" features on the right side of the Traverse Wall.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

pathTokens: Twin Falls and the Snake River Canyon
